etymology.description: Pictogram: three strands of hair; in 昜 and 參 it indicates three light rays.
etymology.interpretation: Three short, tapering strokes depict tufts of hair or bristles, which later broadened to an ornamental sense. In certain compounds the same three strokes were reinterpreted as rays of light, contributing meanings like shine, radiance, or decorative markings.

examples.chinese: 这个部首叫“彡”，表示毛发或装饰(這個部首叫「彡」，表示毛髮或裝飾)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège bùshǒu jiào “shān”, biǎoshì máofà huò zhuāngshì.
examples.english: This radical is called “shān” and denotes hair or ornamentation.

examples.chinese: 在“影”“彩”等字里，彡表示光芒或纹饰(在「影」「彩」等字裡，彡表示光芒或紋飾)。
examples.pinyin: Zài “yǐng” “cǎi” děng zì lǐ, shān biǎoshì guāngmáng huò wénshì.
examples.english: In characters like “影” and “彩,” 彡 indicates rays of light or decorative patterns.

examples.chinese: 古文字把三短笔画写成彡，像三束毛(古文字把三短筆畫寫成彡，像三束毛)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ wénzì bǎ sān duǎn bǐhuà xiě chéng shān, xiàng sān shù máo.
examples.english: Ancient script wrote three short strokes as 彡, resembling three tufts of hair.
